channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Life360 names COO Lauren Antonoff as its new CEO to succeed cofounder
item.description: Life360 has named Lauren Antonoff as its new CEO to succeed cofounder Chris Hulls. The move, which has been in the works since Antonoff joined the com...

item.title: EV sales are surging ahead of tax credits ending. What to know if you’re one of the buyers swarming dealerships now
item.description: The clock is ticking on tax credits for electric vehicles —and that’s pushing a lot of people who were debating whether or not to get one off of the f...

item.title: Trump extends China tariff truce by another 90 days, pushing new deadline to November
item.description: For now, the extension of a truce means that US tariffs on Chinese goods this year stand at 30%.

item.title: Ford Unveils a $2 Billion Facility and Plans for a $30,000 EV Pickup
item.description: The company is also rethinking the automotive assembly line in a way that CEO Jim Farley referred to as a ‘radical change.’

item.title: This Founder Says You Should Discuss Mental Health Issues at Work. Here’s Why You Should Listen
item.description: Discussing personal issues in the office used to be viewed as a cultural no-no. Gen Z thinks that should change.

item.title: Are U.S. stock markets ‘whistling past the graveyard’? Stifel takes a close look at the great American ‘money illusion’
item.description: With the American consumer running out of breath amid an economic slowdown in the second half of 2025, Stifel sees a selloff of 10% or more in the S&P...

item.title: Social media users and health experts raise fresh concerns around kratom-containing drinks like Feel Free
item.description: A “feel good” herbal supplement is facing backlash online after a number of social media users shared their stories of addiction and terrifying health...

item.title: Why Good Leaders Ask Great Questions
item.description: Leaders need to start adopting an attitude of curiosity.

item.title: Former Tesla HR Staff Say They Were Fired for Investigating Allegations of Racism
item.description: They likened working conditions at a Tesla plant in Fremont, California to the “Jim Crow” South.

item.title: Why Ikea is recalling more than 54,000 garlic presses
item.description: It’s common knowledge that garlic makes everything better—but if you’re cooking with a garlic press you bought from Ikea, it’s time to check the model...

item.title: Ford is reinventing the assembly line to make more affordable EVs, starting with a $30,000 electric truck
item.description: Over a century ago, Henry Ford’s assembly line helped mass-produce the Model T, setting a new standard for how to manufacture vehicles. Now, at its Lo...

item.title: AI talent comes at a 30% salary premium: ‘If you try to play catch up later, this is going to cost you even more’
item.description: No longer are AI skills only associated with tech or IT roles.

item.title: Why Many Small-Businesses Owners Fear Even a Short Recession Will Sink Them
item.description: A new survey shows a quarter of small company founders think their critically tight cash flows wouldn’t allow them to survive more than a month were a...

item.title: Exclusive: Fintech giant Stripe building ‘Tempo’ blockchain with crypto VC Paradigm
item.description: Stripe’s newest push into crypto comes as the company has made an aggressive push into stablecoins.

item.title: When the next recession hits, whoever is president will face intense pressure to cut tariffs, so don’t rely on them for revenue, top economist says
item.description: “There’s going to be a strong incentive on that president’s part to say, ‘Okay, I’m going to cut the taxes.’”
